message:
I am sorry, that my first post here is an advertisement, but I hope to contribute in other regards in the future. :)
On Stack Exchange's Area51 site, there is a proposal for an Arabic version of Stackoverflow:
http://area51.stackexchange.com/proposals/75879/stackoverflow-in-arabic?referrer=gbXmSaAtgREukUcaptYG1w2

The proposal needs 33 more comitters for the beta to launch. If you got more than 200 points on a Stack Exchange site and are willing to commit to further this project, please do so!

If you got any questions or thoughts about the proposal, feel free to ask at the proposal site or here in the comments.

Thanks for reading.
story: Ahmad Fatoum shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: StackOverflow (In Arabic) - A Stack Exchange Proposal
caption: area51.stackexchange.com
description: Proposed Q&A site for professional and enthusiastic programmers in Arabic. - مقترح إنشاء موقع أسئلة/إجابات للعرب الهواة والمحترفين في البرمجة

data.message:
Prior discussion detailing benefits of a StackOverflow model site:
https://arabia.io/programming/18461-%D8%A7%D8%AF%D8%B9%D9%85-%D9%85%D9%88%D9%82%D8%B9-stackoverflow-%D8%A8%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B9%D8%B1%D8%A8%D9%8A%D8%A9

Sadly, that post yielded only one new comitter with more than 200 points. I am sure there are people interested in comitting to this project out there, but I got no idea on where to find them.
We mentioned this months ago and got some good support. Go ahead guys and ladies.
What's the point? The very advertising piece you're doing here for an "Arabic" SO is in English :)
^ واحد صاحبي كان لسة قايلي على الجروب ده لاقيت كل البوستات اللي فوق كاتبة انجليزي ام كتبت زيهم :)
بغض النظر :) الرد ده يلخص وجهة نظري في الموضوع: http://programmers.stackexchange.com/questions/1483/do-people-in-non-english-speaking-countries-code-in-english/1507#1507

فيه في الرابط سؤال أنا سألته (وجاوبت على نفسي فيه) لو عايز تعرف وجهة نظري:
http://discuss.area51.stackexchange.com/questions/19474/%D9%87%D9%84-%D9%86%D8%B3%D8%AE%D8%A9-%D8%B9%D8%B1%D8%A8%D9%8A%D8%A9-%D9%87%D9%8A-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AD%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A3%D9%85%D8%AB%D9%84-%D9%84%D9%84%D9%85%D8%B4%D9%83%D9%84%D8%A9-is-an-arabic-so-the-correct-solution
